definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Longju Temple, established during the Sui Dynasty (581-618), is a representative of the historic relics on the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 隋代修建的龍居古剎是這座名山的代表作。

sentences.english: Sui Dai is one of regnant and brief unified reigns on the history.
sentences.chinese: 隋代是歷史上統治短暫的統一王朝之一。

sentences.english: The Longju Temple established during the Sui Dynasty (581-618) is the representative of the historic relics on the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 隋代修建的龍居古剎是這座名山的代表作。

sentences.english: The third part is about contribution of history of Sui Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分重點探討了隋代書法的歷史貢獻。

sentences.english: The Sui Dynasty was a historical period when Buddhism gained a considerably rapid development in our country.
sentences.chinese: 隋代是我國佛教發展較快的一個歷史時期。

sentences.english: Baqiao areas as a result remains within the Old Bridge was built in the Sui Dynasty Bahe named.
sentences.chinese: 灞橋區因境內遺存始建於隋代的灞河古橋而得名。

sentences.english: Hand transcribing is the only means of publishing in Sui Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 手工抄寫是隋代出版的唯一手段。

sentences.english: Long years of split came to an end and a united dynasty was established in the Sui Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 隋代結束了中國多年的分裂，建立了統一的王朝。

definition: Wei of the Northern Dynasties (386-534), founded by the Tuoba 拓跋 branch of Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑
the Northern Zhou Dynasty (557-581)/one of the Northern Dynasties
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
